document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cetonia clathrata Olivier, 1792: 93
, t. 6. Fig. 2 (description; distribution).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Inca clathrata (Olivier, 1792)
:
Neita Moreno et al. 2010: 11
(distribution).

Cetonia Ynca Weber, 1805: 66
;
Burmeister & Schaum 1840: 379
(distribution; references).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution:
GUIANA
(Bates 1888, Howden 1968 ).
PERU
:
Huanuco
: Colonia del Posuso; Río Huallaga ( Soukup 1942 );
San Martín
: Juanjui ( Soukup 1942 ).
BRAZIL
( Blackwelder 1944 ): “Mission de Sarayacu” ( Lucas 1857 ); north Brazil ( Bates 1886 –1890);
Minas Gerais
: “Desertio Prov. Minarum” ( Perty 1830 ).
ARGENTINA
( Blackwelder 1944 ): Misiones ( Bruch 1911a ); [prob. near Puerto Iguazú], 4 exx. ( Hayward 1935 – 1936).

Material examined:
BOLIVIA
: [ Cochabamba ]: Provincia Ichilo , Buenavista ,
II-1950
, A. Martínez leg., 1 male , 4 females [ ODIC ]
.
ARGENTINA
:
Jujuy
: Dto. Santa Bárbara, Villamontes,
I-2009
, A. Borquez leg., 1 male [ ABJCP ]
;
Salta
: [Dto.] Orán, Serranía “Las Pavas”,
21-I-2005
, J. Carreras leg., 1 male , 1 female [ AFBA ]
;
Dto. Orán, Ruta Provincial 19, km 4, J. Carreras leg.,
15-I-2002
, 1 male , 1 female [ JCDT ]
,
16-I-2002
, 1 male , 1 female [ JCDT ]
,
30-I-2008
, 1 male [ LABA ]
,
9-II-2008
, 1 female [ LABA ]
;
Misiones
: Gob. Misiones , 12. 1895, C. Bruch , 1 male , 1 female [ CBBA ], “
Inca
/
clathrata
/ Oliv.” [handwritten by Bruch]; without labels, 1 male [ CBBA ],
genitalia mounted in cardboard.

Note : It is interesting to point out here that, apart from the citations of
I. clathrata
from Misiones ( Argentina ) by Bruch (1911) and Hayward (1935 –1936), this species has not been recorded since in this province, and it is currently found in the area of the Yungas in northwestern Argentina , as well as in the Yungas of Bolivia , Peru and Ecuador . For a discussion about the distributions of the subspecies of
I. clathrata
, see Boos & Ratcliffe (1985) .
